article_text:
It sounds like a cruel prank: Congress creates juicy tax breaks but makes them only temporary. Then, after the benefits expire, lawmakers procrastinate, leaving taxpayers wondering for many months whether those breaks will be extended—and whether they might be altered.

Some prank. Actually, that is the sad reality, thanks to continued Washington paralysis, especially on tax issues. This bizarre situation has sparked reader questions...

twitter.description: Several juicy tax breaks expired at the end of last year but may—or may not—be revived by Congress for this year.
twitter.title: Tax Breaks Remain in Limbo

image.alt: Tax breaks in limbo: Congress may—or may not—revive some popular expired deductions

article_summary:
It sounds like a cruel prank: Congress creates juicy tax breaks but makes them only temporary.
Then, after the benefits expire, lawmakers procrastinate, leaving taxpayers wondering for many months whether those breaks will be extended—and whether they might be altered.
Actually, that is the sad reality, thanks to continued Washington paralysis, especially on tax issues.
Some prank.
This bizarre situation has sparked reader questions...
